headline: Big Bank investors 'on edge' despite strong Q1 results
summary: Bank of America (BAC) and Citi (C) beat expectations with strong first quarter results, boosting investor confidence and lifting both stocks. RBC Capital Markets bank analyst Gerard Cassidy joins Market Domination to break down what's driving bank earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Citigroup Announces Full Redemption of Series P Preferred Stock

headline: Citi Plans to Spend More on Bank’s Turnaround After $3 Billion in 2024
summary: Citi plans to spend more in 2025 than it did last year on fixing long-running risk, data, and compliance deficiencies, as it carries out a yearslong turnaround plan that it refers to as its “transformation.”  Citi CFO Mark Mason said on a call with reporters that the firm is working to move away from manual activity and automate parts of its risk management processes and compliance programs.  Citi is prioritizing its efforts to try and change that.

Citi is prioritizing its efforts to try and change that.

headline: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser Bets US Will 'Still Be World's Leading Economy' And Dollar 'The Reserve Currency' After Trade Uncertainty Settles
summary: Citigroup Inc. (NYSE:C) reported on Tuesday that the first-quarter fiscal 2025 revenue growth was 3% year-over-year and was $21.6 billion, beating the analyst consensus of $21.29 billion. This growth was driven by each of the five interconnected businesses. Excluding divestiture-related impacts in both periods, revenues also went up 3%. The U.S. banking giant reported earnings per share of $1.96, increased from $1.58 a year ago, beating the consensus of $1.84. Also Read: JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, M

headline: Citi and BofA earnings, Johnson & Johnson, China blocks Boeing
summary: On today's Market Minute, Madison Mills recaps the trending stories on Wall Street in just 60 seconds. Citigroup (C) and Bank of America (BAC) stocks gain after reporting earnings that beat analyst estimates. Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) is in focus after reporting earnings results as US President Trump pushes for tariffs on pharmaceutical imports into the US. China reportedly stopped deliveries of Boeing (BA) orders as the US–China trade war continues, according to reporting from Bloomberg. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: BofA, Citi earnings are 'encouraging' for financial sector
summary: Bank of America (BAC) and Citigroup (C) posted stronger-than-expected first quarter results, driven by solid trading revenues and resilient core trends. HSBC head of US financials research Saul Martinez joins Morning Brief to discuss why these earnings reinforce a bullish outlook for both banks and what the results signal for the broader financial sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Bank of America and Citi Report Higher NII, Reiterate Outlook
summary: Citi and Bank of America posted first-quarter net interest income of $14 billion and $14.4 billion, respectively.  Wall Street expected $14.49 billion of NII for the quarter at BofA, according to data compiled by FactSet, and $13.56 billion at Citi.  BofA said in January that it expected to drive between $14.5 billion and $14.6 billion of net interest income on a fully taxable equivalent basis for the first quarter.

BofA said in January that it expected to drive between $14.5 billion and $14.6 billion of net interest income on a fully taxable equivalent basis for the first quarter.

headline: Futures waver, China halts Boeing deliveries, bank earnings: 3 Things
summary: There is a lot for traders to watch on Tuesday, April 15. Stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mixed as the latest Bank of America fund manager survey shows investors are turning bearish. Boeing (BA) is the latest target in the trade war between the US and China, according to a report from Bloomberg. Both Bank of America (BAC) and Citigroup (C) posted better-than-expected earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Bank Trading Desks Are Minting Money From Trump’s Tariff Chaos
summary: Goldman Sachs JPMorgan  Chase and  Morgan Stanley  all said a surge in trading revenue helped lift their profits in the first quarter and beat expectations.  Bank trading desks have been collecting more fees from investors scrambling to reduce or dial up the risk in their portfolios on any new clue about how  President Trump’s  tariffs might ultimately play out.  Combined, the three banks earned more than $12 billion in fees in their equities businesses, the desks that run stock-market related activities for clients.
